Info.Description: 一篇文章一般來說是一篇給出作者自己論點的文章，但定義含糊不清，與信件、論文、文章、摺頁冊和短篇小說的定義重疊。論文傳統上被分劃為正式和非正式。形式散文的特點是"目的嚴重、尊嚴、邏輯組織、長度"，而非正式論文的特點是"個人元素（自我啟示、個人品味和經驗、保密 風格），幽默，優雅的風格，漫不經心的結構，非常規或新穎的主題，"等等。 散文通常用作文學批評、政治宣言、學習的論據、日常生活的觀察、對作者的回憶和反思。幾乎所有的現代散文都是用散文寫的，但詩歌作品被戲稱為散文（例如，亞歷山大·波普的《批評散文》和《人散文》）。雖然簡潔通常定義了一篇文章，但像約翰·洛克的《關於人類理解的散文》和湯瑪斯·馬爾蘇斯的《關於人口原則的散文》這樣的大量作品是反例的。 在一些國家（例如美國和加拿大），論文已成為正規教育的主要部分。中學生被教導結構化的作文形式，以提高他們的寫作技巧;大學在選擇申請人時經常使用錄取論文，在人文和社會科學中，論文經常被用來評估學生在期末考試中的表現。 "論文"的概念已經擴展到了寫作以外的其他媒體。電影散文是一部經常包含紀錄片製作風格，更側重於主題或想法演變的電影。一篇攝影文章涵蓋了一個主題，其中連結了一系列可能附帶的文本或標題的照片。 Application.Description: An essay is, generally, a piece of writing that gives the author's own argument — but the definition is vague, overlapping with those of a letter, a paper, an article, a pamphlet, and a short story. Essays have traditionally been sub-classified as formal and informal. Formal essays are characterized by "serious purpose, dignity, logical organization, length," whereas the informal essay is characterized by "the personal element (self-revelation, individual tastes and experiences, confidential manner), humor, graceful style, rambling structure, unconventionality or novelty of theme," etc.[1] Essays are commonly used as literary criticism, political manifestos, learned arguments, observations of daily life, recollections, and reflections of the author. Almost all modern essays are written in prose, but works in verse have been dubbed essays (e.g., Alexander Pope's An Essay on Criticism and An Essay on Man). While brevity usually defines an essay, voluminous works like John Locke's An Essay Concerning Human Understanding and Thomas Malthus's An Essay on the Principle of Population are counterexamples. In some countries (e.g., the United States and Canada), essays have become a major part of formal education. Secondary students are taught structured essay formats to improve their writing skills; admission essays are often used by universities in selecting applicants, and in the humanities and social sciences essays are often used as a way of assessing the performance of students during final exams. The concept of an "essay" has been extended to other media beyond writing. A film essay is a movie that often incorporates documentary filmmaking styles and focuses more on the evolution of a theme or idea. A photographic essay covers a topic with a linked series of photographs that may have accompanying text or captions. An essay is, generally, a piece of writing that gives the author's own argument — but the definition is vague, overlapping with those of a letter, a paper, an article, a pamphlet, and a short story.
